it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Server.Setup

Class JsonImporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Server.Setup.JsonImporter

  • public class JsonImporter
extends java.lang.Object
    allows to import and parse (from JSON files) external file like card description's file or game configuration files. The utilities here implemented are used from Setup to load cards or configuration file into the GameConfig class
    See Also:
    Setup

    • Constructor Summary

      private JsonImporter()

    • Method Detail

      • importDevelopmentCards

        public static java.util.List<DevelopmentCard> importDevelopmentCards(java.io.Reader fileReader)
                                                              throws java.io.IOException
        method which return a list of development card from an external file correctly formatted. The method accept a FileReader object as parameter, then parse it and finally returns the list of card (which can be passed to the Deck's constructor to generate an effectively deck structure)
        Parameters:
        fileReader - contains the FileReader object relative to the external file to parse
        Returns:
        the list of the cards generated from the JSON external file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • importBonusSpace

        public static com.eclipsesource.json.JsonArray importBonusSpace(java.io.Reader fileReader)
                                                         throws java.io.IOException
        perform the parsing of the action space bonus' configuration file
        Parameters:
        fileReader - contains the FileReader object relative to the external file to parse
        Returns:
        a JsonArray representing the different bonus of all the action space of the board
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • importExcommunicationTrack

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> importExcommunicationTrack(java.io.Reader fileReader)
                                                                                         throws java.io.IOException
        perform the parsing of the victory points configuration relative to the faith track.
        Parameters:
        fileReader - contains the FileReader object relative to the external file to parse
        Returns:
        an HashMap which contains, for all the faith points value of the track, the correspondending value of victory points
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • importPointsConversion

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,com.eclipsesource.json.JsonValue> importPointsConversion(java.io.Reader fileReader)
                                                                                                   throws java.io.IOException
        perform the parsing of the point conversion rules applied for the final score calculation.
        Parameters:
        fileReader - contains the FileReader object relative to the external file to parse
        Returns:
        an HashMap which map for for each rule (for example the number of cards or the victory points to assign to the first and second player on the military track) the corresponding value (as a JsonValue)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • parseCard

        public static DevelopmentCard parseCard(com.eclipsesource.json.JsonValue jCard)
        perform the parsing of a single development card
        Parameters:
        jCard - the JsonValue representing the card to parse
        Returns:
        the DevelopmentCard object obtained from its JsonValue representation
        See Also:
        DevelopmentCard, Tuple, EffectRegistry

      • parseEffect

        private static java.util.List<Tuple<com.eclipsesource.json.JsonValue,com.eclipsesource.json.JsonValue>> parseEffect(com.eclipsesource.json.JsonValue code,
                                                                                                                    com.eclipsesource.json.JsonValue payload)
        parse the effects of a single card
        Parameters:
        code - the OPCODE representing the general effect type
        payload - the JsonValue describing the specific effect
        Returns:
        a list of tuple
        See Also:
        Effect

      • addEffectArray

        private static void addEffectArray(java.util.List<Tuple<com.eclipsesource.json.JsonValue,com.eclipsesource.json.JsonValue>> list,
                                   com.eclipsesource.json.JsonArray code,
                                   com.eclipsesource.json.JsonArray payload)
        given a JsonArray of effect OPCODE of the card and a JsonArray of payload which describes these effects, builds a list of tuple which can be used in the parsing
        Parameters:
        list - a list of tuple
        code - a JsonArray of effect OPCODE
        payload - a JsonArray of payload

      • getEffectFromRegistry

        private static Effect getEffectFromRegistry(java.lang.String effectCode,
                                            com.eclipsesource.json.JsonValue effectPayload)
        allows to retrive from the effect registry the specific effect of the card which is under parsing. The OPCODE is needed to call the correct effect builder, while the effectPayload will be used from the effect builder to build the exactly effect describing the specific card
        Parameters:
        effectCode - the OPCODE of the effect to load
        effectPayload - the JsonValue representing the spcific effect to get from the registry
        Returns:
        the Effect build on the information passed as parameter
        See Also:
        Effect, EffectBuilder

      • registerCardEffects

        private static void registerCardEffects(Card newCard,
                                        com.eclipsesource.json.JsonObject card)
        this method is responsable of loading the effect into the Card class, given its JSON representation (used to build the effects)
        Parameters:
        newCard - the card into which the effect must be registered
        card - the JsonObject representing this card
        See Also:
        Card, Effect
